messages.content: Don't make assumptions about what values to plug into functions. Ask for clarification if a user request is ambiguous.
What's the lowest temperature this Friday?

Could you please tell me which location you’re interested in (e.g. city name or latitude/longitude)? Also, do you mean the upcoming Friday? With that I can look up the forecast and get the low temperature for you.
I’m not sure about the location, I guess you could get it using my phone's location service? And yes, the upcoming Friday.

I don’t have permission to access your device’s location directly. Could you please share your city name or your current latitude and longitude? Once I have that, I can look up the forecast and tell you Friday’s low temperature.
I'm not sure what city I'm in right now, is there a way to figure it out from my phone settings?

You won’t be able to fetch your city directly from your phone’s Settings app, but you can use any map or location‐aware app to read off your current city (or coordinates). Here are two quick methods:

1. Using Google Maps (iOS or Android)  
   – Open Google Maps.  
   – Tap the “locate” button (usually a target or arrow icon) to center on your current position (blue dot).  
   – Press and hold the blue dot to drop a pin.  
   – A card will pop up showing your current address (including city) and/or GPS coordinates.  

2. Using a browser “Where am I” lookup  
   – Open your phone’s web browser and go to:  
     https://www.google.com/search?q=where+am+i  
   – Google will ask permission to access your location—allow it.  
   – You’ll see a map with your current address and city.  

Once you have either your city name or your latitude & longitude, just let me know and I can look up this Friday’s low temperature for you.
Unfortunately, I don't have access to either of those options right now.

I’m still going to need at least some location info—city name, postal/ZIP code, coordinates, or even your time‐zone (e.g. “Eastern Time, USA”)—in order to look up the forecast. Could you share whatever you can about where you are?
I'm really not sure about my location details.

I’ll need at least some rough location data to pull the correct forecast—this could be:

• Country or region (e.g. “United States,” “Ontario, Canada”)  
• Nearest major city you know of (even if it’s 50 km away)  
• Your time zone (e.g. “Eastern Time (ET)”)  
• Postal/ZIP code or area code  

Any one of those will let me look up Friday’s low temperature for you. Could you share whatever of those you have?
